meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>earnings</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to earn income</vocabulary>, because you can't "to income" something. Can also be <vocabulary>to make money</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: <vocabulary>To earn income</vocabulary>, you decided to start a <reading>car</reading> <reading>sa</reading>le. (かせ) "Every car sale, a step to richness!" was your quirky business mantra.
